sense.name: a large truck used to haul material or goods
sense.examples: They watched, through binoculars, a convoy of military transporters along the road. These oversized refrigerated transporters are not allowed on the parkways.

sense.name: a crane used for loading and unloading goods
sense.examples: Two transporters were simultaneously unloading the huge container ship. As we sailed out of the harbor, we saw the large transporters across on the commercial dock.

sense.name: a moving belt used to convey objects
sense.examples: This airport has the longest luggage transporter system in the world. Machine components move around the factory floor via transporters.

sense.name: a science fiction machine that relocates people in space
sense.examples: He asked Scotty to beam him up in the transporter. Mr. Spock and Bones stood in the transporter just as an alien creature materialized there. It's a story about a scientist who becomes horribly transformed when a fly enters his transporter by accident.

sense.name: a business that carries people and/or goods
sense.commentary: TRANSPORTER[+enterprise][+business][+carrier][+people/+goods] Note: refers to a business, not an individual
sense.examples: Their firm is a specialty transporter of exotic flowers from South America. That passenger airline has become a major transporter to Asia.

sense.name: an individual who carries something, e.g, people, things, disease
sense.commentary: TRANSPORTER[+individual][+carrier][+goods/+culture/+disease] Note: often refers to people, but can be other individual agents as well.
sense.examples: She is a full time cook, gardener and transporter of kids to and from soccer practices. He was a transporter of arms to the guerillas in the mountains. Scientists have determined that a certain African plant is the transporter of a new fungus. The early Portuguese sailors were the first transporters of their language to other parts of the world.
